miniaesdemo

Class EncryptionDetails

  • java.lang.Object
    • miniaesdemo.EncryptionDetails

  • public class EncryptionDetails
extends java.lang.Object

    This class generates and stores encryption keys. It provides a straightforward way to access the keys (getKey0(), getKey1(), getKey2() methods).

    Since:
    0.1

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int[] key0
      This variable is an integer array of four elements which stores the initial key.
      private int[] key1
      This variable is an integer array of four elements which stores the first round key.
      private int[] key2
      This variable is an integer array of four elements which stores the second round key.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EncryptionDetails()
      Constructor method that initializes the local variables with empty objects.
      EncryptionDetails(int[] initialKey)
      Constructor method that takes in an initial key as a parameter and automatically generates the rest of the keys using the generateKey1() and generateKey2() methods.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private int[] generateKey1()
      This method generates the first round key using the initial key.
      private int[] generateKey2()
      This method generates the second round key, using the first round key.
      void generateKeys(int[] key)
      This method takes in an initial key as a parameter and generates the rest of the keys using the generateKey1() and generateKey2() methods.
      int[] getKey0()
      Getter method for the initial key.
      int[] getKey1()
      Getter method for the first key.
      int[] getKey2()
      Getter method for the second key.
      void setKey0(java.lang.String key)
      Setter method for the initial key.
      java.lang.String toString(int[] arrayToConvert)
      This method uses the Utilities.intArrayToString(int[]) method to convert the array into a string

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • key0

        private int[] key0

        This variable is an integer array of four elements which stores the initial key. Which is used to calculate the rest of the keys using generateKeys(int[]) method.

      • key1

        private int[] key1

        This variable is an integer array of four elements which stores the first round key. Calculated using key0 with the generateKey1() method.

      • key2

        private int[] key2

        This variable is an integer array of four elements which stores the second round key. Calculated using key1 with the generateKey2() method.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EncryptionDetails

        public EncryptionDetails()

        Constructor method that initializes the local variables with empty objects.

      • EncryptionDetails

        public EncryptionDetails(int[] initialKey)

        Constructor method that takes in an initial key as a parameter and automatically generates the rest of the keys using the generateKey1() and generateKey2() methods.

        Parameters:
        initialKey - A 16-bit binary String Array.

    • Method Detail

      • generateKeys

        public void generateKeys(int[] key)

        This method takes in an initial key as a parameter and generates the rest of the keys using the generateKey1() and generateKey2() methods.

        Parameters:
        key - A variable that contains the initial key value.

      • generateKey1

        private int[] generateKey1()

        This method generates the first round key using the initial key.

        Returns:
        Returns an Integer Array.

      • generateKey2

        private int[] generateKey2()

        This method generates the second round key, using the first round key.

        Returns:
        Returns an Integer Array.

      • setKey0

        public void setKey0(java.lang.String key)

        Setter method for the initial key. It gives users the ability to set the private key0 variable.

        Parameters:
        key - A 16-bit string containing the initial key.

      • getKey0

        public int[] getKey0()

        Getter method for the initial key. It gives users the ability to get the private key0 variable.

        Returns:
        Returns the initial key.

      • getKey1

        public int[] getKey1()

        Getter method for the first key. It gives users the ability to get the private key1 variable.

        Returns:
        Returns the first round key.

      • getKey2

        public int[] getKey2()

        Getter method for the second key. It gives users the ability to get the private key2 variable.

        Returns:
        Returns the second round key.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(int[] arrayToConvert)

        This method uses the Utilities.intArrayToString(int[]) method to convert the array into a string

        Parameters:
        arrayToConvert - An Integer Array to be converted to string.
        Returns:
        Returns a 16-bit binary String.
